history.content:
Recently, we’ve had multiple problems with dirty, re-arranged rooms in Soda Hall. As a result, we are considering changing the room reservation policy for Soda Hall and restricting who can reserve rooms and when.

Please help us avoid having to change the policy!

 

We understand it is the end of the school year and you are all busy with final exams and final projects, but you and your group are part of a larger community and it is still important to be good members of our EECS community.

 

The biggest issues we have right now involve food and furniture moving. Be aware that if you reserve a room, you are responsible for the condition of the room. Most likely rooms are being left open and unlocked after events end and unscheduled groups are using them for spontaneous events, then leaving a mess.

Here are 5 ways you can help:

  1. If you find a room that is messy when you start your event, email pics to csconners@berkeley.edu, then clean up the mess.

  2. Be diligent about picking up keys and making sure rooms are locked & closed up when you leave. That prevents unknown people from using the room & leaving you on the hook for the mess.
  3. At the end of your event, clean up! Any pizza boxes need to be taken to the dumpsters behind Etcheverry Hall – it’s not enough to pile them in or near the trash containers in the room or outside Soda Hall.
  4. Do not bring food or beverages into Soda 306 (HP Auditorium).
  5. Spread the word! If you see someone leaving a mess or moving furniture in or out of a room, remind them of the room policies.

A few small changes on your part can really help make life better for everyone in the community and avoid a change in the reservation policies in the future.
